summary: A new facility, and faction, with lots of toys.
descriptionHtml:
Thumper was a former stealthy/Mage/marksman, who was very good at his job. When the war broke out down south, however, he came north with his daughter and wife, in an attempt to build a new life.

Seeing the state of things, and the lack of resources for information here, he chose to do something about that. Rumors are that he was starting up a college, where people would be able to learn a variety of things.

He opened an inn, and was going to start the college up from that point, a reasonable thing. He has gone quiet right now, however, and family is wanting to know why.

Will you aid his family, and restore the place to a shade of what he intended for this facility, before he went quiet? What really happened? Where is his family?

Will you be able to use the information that the family has to it's best use?

And maybe even find out the greatest secret of all :

"I am looking from outside, and I don't even see so much as a carrot! Why is this called a farm?" :)

===

- All you need to do to start is ask a bartender about work.

===


This mod adds a number of things.

1) New quests.
2) New NPC's.
3) New Crafting Tables.
4) New Spells
5) New twists on various things in the game.
6) New Items
7) New Recipes to make
8) New Plants
9) New toys to play with.

===

Quests :

A full line of quests to bring the facility back to the state that Thumper left it in. It was incomplete then, so keep that in mind. He never officially opened.

===

NPC :

A full staff at the new college facility. Includes trainers in various skills.

===

Crafting Tables

A series of crafting tables to expand your production.

Arrow station : Enchant normal arrows with frost, fire, and Shock.
Pulper : Convert wood items into paper.
Ink Station : Make your own ink
Scribe Station : Make your own scrolls and spell books, based on the spells you know.

Soul Gem Workbench : Convert normal and empty soul gems into larger or smaller sizes.
Cloth Processer : Converts unneeded clothing into cloth.
Sewing Rack : Sew the basic cloth clothing in the game.
Arcane Smelter : Acts Like a normal smelter, without the shoveling.

===

Spells

Cure Disease : As the name says.
Mining Beam : Destruction spell : Mines minerals, from a distance, at a rapid rate.
Bound PickAxe : So you don't have to carry a pick axe
Bound Lumber Axe : So you don't have to carry a lumber axe
Strip : Strip the clothes from a target (Doesn't provide true nudity without other mods)

===

Twists on various things

Reasons for other quests to happen in game.
New tactics based on some of the modifications.
(Can you find 2 other uses for the mining beam spell, other than mining? :) )


===

Items

Get supplies that you can use with other things.

Lesser hist sap
Moon Sugar Grass
Sleeping Sap trees

Make arrows wtih enchantments to damage

Poison Apples


===

Recipes

New Cooking recipees. Make your own skooma, moon sugar, Balmora Blue, and other things.


===

Plants

Regrowing nirnroot (Actual plants, not activators that disable)
Lesser Hist Trees
Moon Sugar Grass
Jerrin Root

===

Toys

Copy multiple locations from a map!

Dragon Soul Distillery
Vampire Stone
Magical Mining coffers

Bug out Bags, with emergency supplies

Secret hide-aways.

===

and more...

Will you solve the mysteries, find the hidden toys, and rebuild Thumper's Farm?



===


=====
=====
HMTF DG

NOTE : The Dawnguard Expansion is in the optional files. You need the main file to get it to run. The main file doesn't need it, however

Changes :
Vendors stock modified
Aetherium Coins available
New Aetherium Recipes for the Aetherium Forge
Alternate methods for crossbows and explosive bolts (Even usable for vampire lords)

and other things.

===
HMTF DB

Dragonborn expansion.

Does not require Dawnguard to play. Does require HMTF2 and Dragonborn.

Adds :
Waterwalk Spell
New temporary home location
Copyable Map with locations for island
a few other minor things.
=====

Walkthrough Book

This  is a simple cheat style book. Since much of the mod is vague, you can use this for hints, if you like/need.

You can find this book for Free, in Nightgate Inn, on the barrel near the door, in the corner. (Where you find Foxy in the beginning.)

If you want it, you can snag it. If you don't want it, you don't need to get it. Your call. :) Enjoy
Note : With me figuring out arrow markers, this SHOULDN'T be needed

===

Most Recent Edits :

Warning : Possible Spoilers!


HM Thumpers Farm 1.3 (Main File)
﻿Changes :
﻿ ﻿Added Arrow quest markers for all quests.
﻿ ﻿Changed Directions of Dressers in Barracks that were turned around.
﻿ ﻿Added Clothes changing functionality, based on package. (They change automatically. You don't choose for them)
﻿ ﻿Fixed some Dialogue that prevented Constance from offering to sell things later on.
﻿In Honorhall Takeover :
﻿ ﻿﻿ ﻿If Grelod attacks you, Constance will not run away from you afterwords.
﻿ ﻿ ﻿If you attack her first, Constance will still run, forcing you to do the DB quest stuff first.
﻿ ﻿ ﻿If Grelod attacks you, you can continue with Constance immediately, without going to do the Dark Brotherhood quest before hand.
﻿ ﻿Guards and people will comment, based on if Grelod went "Psycho" or was killed.
﻿ ﻿Several points that were set up as doors are now assigned as Activators that portal you... to prevent issues with quests pointing to the secret doors, instead of the main entrance of the facility.

﻿... And a host of other little things. (Those are the big ones though.)



HMTF2 DG 1.2 is up
     Changes :
﻿Added arrow quest markers mostly.
﻿Other than that : Not much. Perhaps a few extra items in the prison, but nothing other than decoration.

HMTF2 DB 1.3 is up
    Changes :
﻿Changed a few things for vendor selection
﻿Added a staff enchanter in the enenchanting area
﻿Added blank staves to Heather's inventory (For the enchanter)
﻿ ﻿Note : They use all the default aspects as DragonBorn enchanter.
author: Rex1029 aka Pan Dragondagger
